page.title: 08Children's Pets
page.content: A recent survey showed that{dogs and {cats}were the most popular of family pets with{rabbits}in third place. In the homes of 25 children there were 40 dogs of which 7 dogs could be called {working dogs}on sheep farms. Twenty two children kept some 45 cats of which a number were for pest control on farms. Fourteen children owned rabbits; 7 with{goldfish;}3 each with{budgies}and {mice;}1 each with a{gerbil}and a {guinea}pig. Two children had{horses and several children had an assortment of temporary pets such as{lambs, kids, {chickens,}etc. The{breeds of dogs named were 6 collie sheepdogs, 2 Old English sheepdogs, 2 Alsatians, 2 Spaniels and 1 each of Jack Russell, Irish Wolfhound, Yorkshire Terrier and a Great Dane.
